original: Andersson, Johan Louis, lasaretts-läkare, Uddevalla, f. 8/5/91 i Görslöv, Malmöh. 1., av Anders Jönsson o. Karna Larsson. G. 21 m. Siri Ryd-stam. Barn: Kjerstin f. 22, g. m. 0’dont. kand. Nils-0’lof Christensson, Sthlim, Ingår 28. — Stud:ex. 10, med. kand. 13^ o. med. Hc. 20, allt i Lund. Div. aman: förordn. v. olika klin. 16-19, aman. o. und :läk. v. kir. klin. i Lund 20-24, aman. v. gynekol. klin. där 25, und :läk. där 25-27, lär. v. Syd-sv. gymn. inst. i Lund 21-22, v. Södra Sv:es sjuksköt :hem i Lund 23-24, bitr. lär. i kir. i Lund 24-27, i obstetr. o. gynekol. 26-27, und :l’äk. v. Hälsing- borg-s Jas. kir. avd. 28-29, tf. las :läk. i Norrtälje 29, das :läk. där 29-32, las:-■läk. v. Uddevalla las. kir. avd. sed. 32. Landstingsman 39. Stud:res. t. Wien 22, t. tyska klin. 24 o. 29. Skr.: upps. m. kir. inneh. RNO.
translated: Andersson, Johan Louis, hospital physician, Uddevalla, b. May 8, 1891 in Görslöv, Malmöhus County, son of Anders Jönsson and Karna Larsson. Married to Siri Ryd-stam on March 21. Children: Kjerstin, b. 1922, married to Odont. Cand. Nils-Olof Christensson from Stockholm, included in 1928. Attended Studentexamen (high school) in 1910, medical degree in 1913 and medical license in 1920, all in Lund. Various assistant positions appointed by different clinics from 1916-1927, assistant and assistant doctor at the surgical clinic in Lund from 1920-1924, assistant at the gynecology clinic there in 1925, assistant doctor there from 1925-1927, and teacher at the South-Swedish gymnastics institution in Lund from 1921-1922, at the Southern Swedish Nursing Home in Lund from 1923-1924, and assistant teacher in surgery in Lund from 1924-1927 and obstetrics and gynecology in 1926-1927. Assistant doctor at the Helsingborg County Hospital Surgical Department from 1928-1929, temporary hospital physician in Norrtälje in 1929, hospital physician there from 1929-1932, and hospital physician at the Uddevalla Hospital Surgical Department since 1932. County Councilman since 1939. Study trips to Vienna in 1922, to German clinics in 1924 and 1929. Writer of papers on surgery, including RNO (Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star).

awards.name: Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star
